definitions.definition: A negative aspect; a downer , a downside .
examples: I love almost everything about my job. The only down is that I can't take Saturdays off.

definitions.definition: An act of swallowing an entire drink at once.
( American football ) A single play, from the time the ball is snapped (the start) to the time the whistle is blown (the end) when the ball is down , or is downed .
examples: I bet after the third down , the kicker will replace the quarterback on the field.

definitions.definition: ( crosswording ) A clue whose solution runs vertically in the grid .
examples: I haven't solved 12 or 13 across, but I've got most of the downs .

definitions.definition: A downstairs room of a two-story house.
examples: She lives in a two-up two- down .

definitions.definition: The lightest quark with a charge number of − ⁄ 3 .

main_definition: A negative aspect; a downer , a downside .
secondary_definitions: An act of swallowing an entire drink at once.
( American football ) A single play, from the time the ball is snapped (the start) to the time the whistle is blown (the end) when the ball is down , or is downed .
( crosswording ) A clue whose solution runs vertically in the grid .
A downstairs room of a two-story house.
The lightest quark with a charge number of − ⁄ 3 .

definitions.definition: ( especially Southern England , also Australia , often plural , often in place names ) A hill ; in England, especially a chalk hill.
examples: We went for a walk over the downs .
The North Downs are a ridge of chalk hills in south east England.

definitions.definition: ( usually in the plural ) A field, especially one used for horse racing.
( UK , chiefly in the plural ) A tract of poor, sandy, undulating or hilly land near the sea, covered with fine turf which serves chiefly for the grazing of sheep.

main_definition: ( especially Southern England , also Australia , often plural , often in place names ) A hill ; in England, especially a chalk hill.
secondary_definitions: ( usually in the plural ) A field, especially one used for horse racing.
( UK , chiefly in the plural ) A tract of poor, sandy, undulating or hilly land near the sea, covered with fine turf which serves chiefly for the grazing of sheep.

definitions.definition: Soft, fluffy immature feathers which grow on young birds. Used as insulating material in duvets , sleeping bags and jackets .
The pubescence of plants ; the hairy crown or envelope of the seeds of certain plants, such as the thistle .
The soft hair of the face when beginning to appear.
That which is made of down, as a bed or pillow; that which affords ease and repose, like a bed of down.
